Running

Running is one of the most accessible and effective forms of cardio. It strengthens the heart and lungs, burns a significant number of calories, and boosts mood by releasing endorphins. Whether youâ€™re running short sprints or long-distance, this exercise challenges your cardiovascular system, builds leg strength, and improves endurance. Over time, regular running can help you achieve better stamina and speed, making it an ideal exercise for both beginners and experienced athletes. Running can also improve bone density due to the impact involved, making it beneficial for long-term bone health.
